title: Database Cluster Failure
description: Primary database cluster experienced unexpected failover during peak business hours, affecting production systems for 45 minutes. Root cause identified as misconfigured replication settings after recent upgrade.
root_cause: Configuration error - replication lag threshold set incorrectly during maintenance window
vendor_actions_taken: Immediate rollback to stable configuration, implemented additional monitoring alerts, conducted full audit of recent changes
business_impact: Medium - some users experienced read-only access, no data loss
follow_up_actions: Vendor provided detailed post-mortem within 24 hours

title: Network Latency Spike
description: Users reported slow application response times during morning hours. Investigation revealed upstream ISP routing issue affecting regional connectivity.
root_cause: External ISP routing instability - outside vendor control
vendor_actions_taken: Quickly identified issue was external, coordinated with ISP, implemented temporary routing workaround
business_impact: Low - degraded performance but no service interruption
follow_up_actions: Proposed secondary ISP connection for redundancy (additional cost)

title: Scheduled Maintenance Overrun
description: Planned maintenance window extended by 30 minutes due to unexpected complications with security patches.
root_cause: OS patch compatibility issue discovered during deployment
vendor_actions_taken: Proactively notified stakeholders of delay, rolled back changes safely, completed patches during next window
business_impact: Very Low - occurred during scheduled downtime, minimal user impact
follow_up_actions: Added buffer time to future maintenance windows
